config.question: What conspiracy did Washington see behind the Whiskey Rebellion?

choices.content: He believed the Republicans had dispatched French agents to Pennsylvania to undermine the federal government.
He believed that it was instigated by the governor of Pennsylvania.
He believed that it was a result of discontentment among the southern farmers.
He believed that it was instigated by the Republicans, who had used British agents to undermine the federal government in Pennsylvania.

answer_3.response: Washington blamed the Republican clubs for promoting civil unrest. He apparently believed that the opposition party had dispatched French agents to western Pennsylvania to undermine the federal government.
